meanings.definition: To descend or submerge in water or another liquid.
meanings.sent1: The boat slowly sank beneath the waves.
meanings.sent2: After the rain, the water level in the pond sank.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat sank its paw into the bathtub water.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the city sank into darkness.
meanings.sent5: The heavy rock sank quickly to the bottom of the river.

meanings.definition: To decrease in value, amount, or quality.
meanings.sent1: With time, the interest in the old trend sank.
meanings.sent2: The temperature sank as the night grew colder.
meanings.sent3: The excitement sank when the party got canceled.
meanings.sent4: Her heart sank when she heard the bad news.
meanings.sent5: The hope for a better future sank with each passing day.

meanings.sent1: Yesterday, the ship sank in the stormy sea.
meanings.sent2: The coin sank to the bottom of the fountain.
meanings.sent3: The cake sank in the middle, but it still tasted delicious.
meanings.sent4: The sun sank below the horizon, painting the sky in hues of orange.
meanings.sent5: The anchor sank into the sandy ocean floor, securing the boat in place.
